w_new_1_fix_note: W-NEW-1 fix (Session 7, P-S7-1): date corrected from 2026-02-19 to 2026-02-18 per SSoT unification declared in Session 4.

kids_zeff.note_on_published: The published z_eff=0.26 from Asgari et al. (2021) is the lensing-efficiency-weighted effective source redshift, accounting for the full n(z) convolved with the geometric lensing kernel. It is NOT the mean or median galaxy redshift.
kids_zeff.model_approximation: n(z) model: sum of 5 Gaussians approximating KiDS-1000 tomographic bin distributions. Actual KiDS n(z) from public data release is preferred. This is a first-principles reconstruction for comparison purposes.

analysis.interpretation: The published z_eff=0.26 for KiDS-Legacy is LOWER than our n(z)-based estimates (mean=0.526, median=0.509). This is expected: the lensing-efficiency weight upweights low-z sources (where lensing efficiency is higher), pulling z_eff below the galaxy mean. The published z_eff=0.26 is consistent with the standard definition used in cosmic shear analyses. Mean n(z) z_eff = 0.526 >= 0.40: True.
analysis.conclusion: Section 1 cross-term model was re-run with updated KiDS z_eff (Session 2, P1 fix) — result: NOT meaningful (max Δtension = 0.100σ < 0.5σ threshold). [Corrected from stale pre-Session-2 text per ng.md 付記, Session 7]
